attributes.action: Improve late payments legislation to reduce credit control issues for businesses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current bad practice that exists with late payment in the U.K is severly effecting small to medium businesses and the unfair payment terms imposed on small businesses selling to larger organisations is forcing small to medium businesses to close leading to increases in small businesses going out of business.
The following information shows how bad the U.K is when it comes to late payments and corporate bullying when it comes to payment terms.

A recent web poll by the Better Payment Practice Group found that of 420 respondents 69% were worried that they may lose an important customer to a business rival if they insisted on prompt payment. This fear was strongest in the smallest businesses.

A massive £18.6 billion is the figure put on outstanding payments owed to Britain’s small-to-medium sized enterprises – a leap of £2.6 billion in the last year, according to new research commissioned by Bacs.
